name: Hocus Pocus
description: Terexin, leader of the Council of Wizards, is sending the young sorcerer, Hocus, on a special mission to prove his worthiness.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7 or Windows 8 Processor: Intel Core Due 2 Memory: 2 GB RAM

reviews.review_text: Lagendary game of my childhood, shed a tear :' )

I grew up on this game. Oh the memories, i feel so old now....   Between the old DOS games available on steam, this is one of the best out there. Old-school platformer with a lot of puzzles. Magnificent. Its old, i mean really old, dont expect anything like we have nowadays. A true classic that aged well.  And just because its old, it aint easy. There are some very hard segments in it.

I was six years old  when my dad brought home a shareware diskette containing the first chapter of Hocus Pocus. This was my introduction to platformers. Not at all a bad introduction -- looking back at it over twenty years later, the 2D art and music remains effortlessly charming. The game's many chapters and levels take place across an abundance of distinct themes, which keeps the simplistic gameplay from growing stale. Put your nostalgia goggles on for this one.
This is an awesome game. I have played this game for many many years.

An old platformer. Shoot enemies and collect items. Collect 5 orbs to progress to the next level. Annoying spawning of enemies killed it for me. They spawn right in front of you. You are a wizard with only one attack. No, thanks.
